headshotImage.caption: Ashish Nehra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashish Nehra player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ross Taylor lbw b Nehra 95 (113b 8x4 1x6 173m) SR: 84.07

dismissalComment.html: Out five short of 100. He played a fab knock but he is gone now. It was the full-length delivery  that straightened on the middle-stump line and he tried to work it across the line and missed it completely. Trapped! He has done the hard work and has put NZ in a strong position. Can the lower order push them on ahead?

headshotImage.longCaption: Pragyan Ojha player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Scott Styris b Ojha 89 (95b 9x4 1x6 132m) SR: 93.68

dismissalComment.html: Ojha takes him out! He had problem with Jadeja in the last over, playing across the line. And he does it again now. It was a loopy delivery on the middle and off stump line, Styris lunged forward and ended up playing all around it. He isn't happy as he walks off but what a fine knock this was. Oram walks in

headshotImage.caption: Ashish Nehra player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ashish Nehra player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Peter Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Peter Ingram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Nehra gets some leather on wood this time. It was in the corridor, seaming away ever so late and Ingram was looking to defend but it got the outside edge. India on the attack here. Both bowlers fresh as they didn't play the Test series and doing the job here.

headshotImage.caption: Jacob Oram player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacob Oram player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Trapped! That bouncer is followed by a skidding short-of-length delivery on the middle-stump line. Oram wafted across the line, bat going across in an angle, and missed. Gone!

headshotImage.caption: LRPL Taylor headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: LRPL Taylor headshot

dismissalComment.html: Out five short of 100. He played a fab knock but he is gone now. It was the full-length delivery  that straightened on the middle-stump line and he tried to work it across the line and missed it completely. Trapped! He has done the hard work and has put NZ in a strong position. Can the lower order push them on ahead?

headshotImage.caption: Daryl Tuffey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Daryl Tuffey player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Tuffey holes out at long-on. He cleared the front foot and drilled it high but couldn't clear the fielder at the boundary. Nice little cameo from him though to push NZ towards 300. Can they reach there?

headshotImage.caption: Praveen Kumar, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Praveen Kumar, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: MJ Guptill headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: MJ Guptill headshot

dismissalComment.html: PK has been getting some movement - both in and out - and strikes with this delivery. It moves away late from the off stump line and the batsman gets the edge on the defensive prod. He was looking to come forward to defend and tried to cover for the movement but it shaped away to catch the edge. Simple catch through to Dhoni.

headshotImage.caption: KS Williamson headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KS Williamson headshot

dismissalComment.html: Out for a duck! What a ball, though. P E A C H. It curved in the air, landed on the middle stump line and you could sense why Williamson was shaping to play it towards say mid-on. But the ball moved away at the last instant, opened him up completely, and pegged back the off stump. Clatter! Things are bound to get better from here on Williamson. You can't get such a good delivery every time you walk out to bat. He doesn't look  back at the destruction. He has a look at where it landed, his mouth frozen into an bewildered expression of  'oooh' and he walks away.
banged in short and Hopkins goes for the big shot, attempts the pull shot but holes out at deep square-leg region

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Raina) 9 (5b 2x4 0x6 9m) SR: 180

dismissalComment.html: They won't. Raina with the direct hit. It was pushed towards short extra cover. Mills charged across. His partner had frozen long time back. Raina picked the ball, Mills turned back and Raina fired. Gone! Fine performance from NZ to survive the pressure exerted by the early wickets and reach this far.

dismissalText.commentary: Ravindra Jadeja c Styris b Williamson 20 (44b 2x4 0x6 60m) SR: 45.45

dismissalComment.html: And another slip catch. Loverly! It was floated well outside off stump and Jadeja chased it for a big drive. Styris takes the catch. Where is Taylor I say? Williamson was out for a duck but picks up a wicket now. Life can't be that bad eh?

headshotImage.caption: KD Mills headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: KD Mills headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Virender Sehwag c †Hopkins b Mills 19 (23b 3x4 0x6 31m) SR: 82.6

dismissalComment.html: got him! Sehwag has never liked the short ball aimed at the body and Mills did well to persist with that line of attack. Sehwag was in trouble once earlier looking to pull, this time he gets some glove on it as it goes down the leg and it is through to the keeper for an easy take. Sehwag is gone.

headshotImage.caption: Daryl Tuffey player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Daryl Tuffey player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Karthik player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Two in Two! Dinesh Karthik goes this time, it was an in-ducker from outside off and Karthik played down the wrong line as he played the forward defensive. He missed the ball and was struck flush on the pads in front of off. It looked plumb despite the fact that he was standing out of the crease. Replays suggest it would have carried over the stumps, with the bounce but well...

headshotImage.caption: RG Sharma headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: RG Sharma headshot

dismissalComment.html: Thanks for coming! It was all so simple; something that you see usually in the catching practice in the morning before the game. This delivery kicked up from short of length outside off stump and Rohit opened the bat-face and guided it straight to first slip. Simple. Tuffey smiles.

headshotImage.caption: SK Raina headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: SK Raina headshot

dismissalComment.html: Oh well! Edged straight to second slip. It was a short-of-length delivery outside off stump and Raina stabbed at it, bat away from the body, and it goes straight to the slip cordon. The ball cut away from him and he ended up chasing it.

dismissalComment.html: Awww. That slip catch again. Well... the top order didn't last. Why would the lower-order batsmen? It was the short of length delivery that kicked up outside off and PK steers it straight to slip cordon.
Yep. You guessed it right. Another slip catch. Fullish and outside off stump and Mithun edges his drive. Just two more now. How quickly can NZ wrap this up?

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni run out (Tuffey) 2 (9b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 22.22

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni is run out and he walks. His scratchy innings comes to an end. This one was jabbed close to the off side and he wants a single. His partner doesn't. Yuvraj took couple of steps down the track and froze. And Dhoni tries to turn back. Too late. Tuffey had already screamed past him, swooped on the ball and flicked a direct hit. Gone!

dismissalText.commentary: Ashish Nehra c Oram b Mills 4 (11b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 36.36

commentTextItems.html: And it's all over. Full and outside off and Nehra drives it straight to mid-off. NZ win by 200 runs. Magnificent thumping win! A rout!

commentPostTextItems.html: Nick: "Mighty proud of the lads, well worth staying up til 3:30am. Batting by Rosscoe and Scotty was amazing, bowling was also outstanding. The same type of delivery dismissed most of the Indian team. Can't help but feel that India lost a ton of momentum when Scotty and Ross entrenched themselves but will be glad to see India come back with a vengeance!"
Rajiv: "Seems the entire Indian team could do with a FREE screening of the new movie "Despicable Me". Ah! I have to see that movie. Perhaps tonight. The game has ended so early.
Hariharan: "To all Jadeja baiters : He is the top scorer in this innings with a splendid fighting 20. Take that!"
Swapnil: "So whats the news - has Taylor enforced the follow-on? There's still 18 overs to be played for stumps right?"
Saravanan: "The individual scores of Taylor and Styris are more than the total score of India..  As usual shall we blame it on lights?"
Mukunth: "Nehra - A Class Act - the only man to get caught out in front of the wicket!"
Naveen: "In cricket, it's usual, not to worry so much. People who have never held the bat in  life  ..,they will never understand this result. i know india will be back and will win the series."

Sarma: "I agree with Naveen! It's just one of those days... India had played games like that earlier as well. No worries..They will bounce back. It's easy to comment from here and difficult to play from there. It's not a good game, I agree. But wins and losses are part and parcel of the game!"
Mikey: "Why does it always take so long to get to the presentations up there? Down here in Aus they into  and thru it fairly quickly, but it seems to take forever sometimes, especially in SL."

MS Dhoni: "Ross and Styris batted really well. We got couple of chances but we didn't accept it. The wicket had spongy bounce and that was what did the trick. they got a kind of bounce that put us in awkward situation."

Ross Taylor: "It was a tough decision to leave out Jeetan Patel today. We are happy with the way we came back today. Nehra and Praveen bowled really well. We got a partnership going and thought it would be great to reach 250-260 and we reached 288. "
Taylor is also the man of the match for his superb 95.
That's it from us. Thanks for logging on. See you at the next game.

dismissalText.commentary: Kane Williamson b Kumar 0 (9b 0x4 0x6 7m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Out for a duck! What a ball, though. P E A C H. It curved in the air, landed on the middle stump line and you could sense why Williamson was shaping to play it towards say mid-on. But the ball moved away at the last instant, opened him up completely, and pegged back the off stump. Clatter! Things are bound to get better from here on Williamson. You can't get such a good delivery every time you walk out to bat. He doesn't look  back at the destruction. He has a look at where it landed, his mouth frozen into an bewildered expression of  'oooh' and he walks away.

dismissalComment.html: Tuffey holes out at long-on. He cleared the front foot and drilled it high but couldn't clear the fielder at the boundary. Nice little cameo from him though to push NZ towards 300. Can they reach there?

dismissalText.commentary: Kyle Mills run out (Raina) 9 (5b 2x4 0x6 9m) SR: 180

dismissalComment.html: They won't. Raina with the direct hit. It was pushed towards short extra cover. Mills charged across. His partner had frozen long time back. Raina picked the ball, Mills turned back and Raina fired. Gone! Fine performance from NZ to survive the pressure exerted by the early wickets and reach this far.

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Karthik lbw b Tuffey 14 (20b 2x4 0x6 33m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: Two in Two! Dinesh Karthik goes this time, it was an in-ducker from outside off and Karthik played down the wrong line as he played the forward defensive. He missed the ball and was struck flush on the pads in front of off. It looked plumb despite the fact that he was standing out of the crease. Replays suggest it would have carried over the stumps, with the bounce but well...

dismissalComment.html: Dhoni is run out and he walks. His scratchy innings comes to an end. This one was jabbed close to the off side and he wants a single. His partner doesn't. milestones.description: Scott Styris and Ross Taylor's 190-run partnership is NZ's highest for the 4th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 168 between Chris Harris and Lee Germon

stories.title: India undone by 'spongy' bounce
stories.subTitle: India v New Zealand, 1st ODI, Dambulla
stories.seoTitle: India v New Zealand: India undone by 'spongy' bounce
stories.summary: Every now and then the Indian batting is tested in difficult one-day conditions, and they usually tend to come up short, though not as spectacularly as against New Zealand in the opening match of the tri-series
